*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to M. B. Menard, November 13, 1830. Appointing Menard his agent in Nacogdoches to give immigrants certificates of reception into Austin's colony. Instructions for execution of this commission.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-13-1830">Novr 13. 1880*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr M. B. Menard*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dr Sir, The enclosed letter from *person_mentioned*T. F. McKinny Esqr*/person_mentioned*. will explain to you the reasons why I have taken the liberty of troubling you with this letter and the enc[l]osed instructions. I applied to *person_mentioned*Mr. McKinney*/person_mentioned* to recommend to me a suitable *person_mentioned*person */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*as *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to give certificates of reception to *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*bound to this *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*, who pass through that place. On his recommendation I have sent to you the enclosed appointment and instructions made out in Spanish. He has aprised me that you would attend to it, and that full confidence might be placed in you. I hope this will be sufficient to explain to you why I have troubled you with this matter. Should you feel any unwillingness to attend to it, you can return the papers to me, or to*person_mentioned* Mr. S. M. Williams*/person_mentioned* at this place by some safe conveyance.*/p*
*p*The object of the certificates which you are to issue to the *person_mentioned*emigrants*/person_mentioned*, is to place Evidence in their hands that they are a part of the *person_mentioned*Settlers */person_mentioned*who enter into my contracts, which they can present to *person_mentioned*Col. Piedras*/person_mentioned*, so as to avoid any detention or difficulty in pursuing their journey to this *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I send you a *location_mentioned*pamphlet */location_mentioned*containing translations of the colonization laws, and of my contracts with Government. You will see that the 5 article of my contract (page 49) prohibits me from admitting *person_mentioned*criminals */person_mentioned*etc etc (see the said article) This article is cited in the 2d. article of your instructions. I wish to do my duty strickly. The object of the government I understand to be, to keep out bad and useless *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, and to admit all who are honest, industrious and moral, and I wish you to keep that rule in view in giving the certificates. Men of *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*who bring their *person_mentioned*wives */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*are less objectionable in general than single *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, and I wish you to be more cautions and particular with the latter class, than with the former.*/p*
*p*I do not require that all should be rejected who bring no recommendations with them, for I know that many good *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*emigrate without providing themselves with recommendations, because they are not apprised of the necessity of doing so. A *person_mentioned*vagabond */person_mentioned*or an indolent *person_mentioned*drunken*/person_mentioned*, or *person_mentioned*disorderly */person_mentioned*person is very apt to shew what he is by his appearance, conversation or deportment and a nice observer may generally form a pritty correct idea of him on a short acquaintance*/p*
*p*I must request that you take pains to impress upon the *person_mentioned*emigrants*/person_mentioned* the necessity of presenting themselves, immediately to*person_mentioned* Col. Piedras*/person_mentioned*, and that they treat him with respect and attention which is due to the *person_mentioned*commanding officer of this *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*on that *location_mentioned*frontier*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and also that they treat all the *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*authorities of this government*/person_mentioned* with proper respect, and I hope you will refuse certificates to all who fail to do so.*/p*
*p*Shew your instructions to *person_mentioned*Col. Piedras*/person_mentioned*, as you are required to do in the 7 article and have a friendly understanding with him. try to remove all difficulties to the emigration of good *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, and get all through you can who are worthy of being admitted: Trouble *person_mentioned*Piedras*/person_mentioned* as little as possible; but call on him often enough to shew that you respect his authority and wish to act in concert with him.*/p*
*p*You will of course expect a compensation for your trouble. This business is for the benefit of the *person_mentioned*emigrant*/person_mentioned*, and I think that each certificate ought to entitle you to receive half a dollar from the person who gets it, and you can charge that sum— Should you think this insufficient write me frankly your views on the subject*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*N. B. I hope you will keep me informed of whatever may occur of interest. In my absence your letters will be answered by *person_mentioned*Mr S. M. Williams*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*Nombramto de*person_mentioned* M. B. Menard*/person_mentioned* como mi *person_mentioned*agente en *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*Algunos *person_mentioned*emigrados */person_mentioned*honrados y dignos de ser recibidos en las contratas de colonización q. tengo celebradas con el *person_mentioned*Gobno Mexno*/person_mentioned*—, entran en el territorio *location_mentioned*Mex*/location_mentioned*° sin los pasaportes necesarios; parte por no saber que era preciso tener pasaportes, y otra parte por no poder conseguirlos por la falta de un *person_mentioned*agente */person_mentioned*competente en *location_mentioned*el puerto*/location_mentioned* de su prosedencia para espedirlos— A fin de remediar estos embarazos que impiden la *person_mentioned*población */person_mentioned*y progreso del *location_mentioned*pais*/location_mentioned*, y para cumplir con mas ecsactitud con la ley de colonización, y con mis contratas celebradas con el Gobno, sobre la introducción de *person_mentioned*familias*/person_mentioned*; he nombrado al *person_mentioned*vecino de *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**person_mentioned*M. B. Menard*/person_mentioned* mi *person_mentioned*agente */person_mentioned*pa espedir certificados a los *person_mentioned*emigrados */person_mentioned*pr. esta *location_mentioned*colonia */location_mentioned*que pasan por *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*. Mi dicho apoderado observara las instrucciones siguientes en la materia.—Io. Espedirá á los *person_mentioned*emigrados */person_mentioned*un certificado en esta forma. " certifico qe______________entra en las contratas de colonización del *location_mentioned*Emp° Dn. Estevan F. Austin*/location_mentioned*, pudiendo recogerle este certificado spre qe. sea justificado qe. el dho------------------[no] es *person_mentioned*hombre */person_mentioned*malo, *person_mentioned*fugitivo*/person_mentioned*, ó *person_mentioned*vagabundo*/person_mentioned*" beha y firma como *person_mentioned*Agente del dho Emp*/person_mentioned*°—2o. Al espedir dhos certificados mi dho *person_mentioned*agente */person_mentioned*tendrá á la vista el articulo 5o. de mi contrata celibrada con el *person_mentioned*Gobno*/person_mentioned*. *date_mentioned n="07-04-1825">4 de Julio 1825—*/date_mentioned*3o. Tomará especial cuidado de no dar certificados a ningún *person_mentioned*hombre malo*/person_mentioned*, ó aun de costumbres sospechosas que dan motivos de creer qe. es *person_mentioned*boracho*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*osioso*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*revoltoso*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*fugitive*/person_mentioned*, ó *person_mentioned*vagabundo*/person_mentioned*—4o. Ecsaminara á los solteros con mas cuidado qe. a los de *person_mentioned*familias*/person_mentioned*, porqe. el tener familia ofrece una especie de garantia para la conducta ó industria del individuo. 5o. No dará certificados á ningunos que hayan faltado al respecto debido á cualquiera *person_mentioned*Autoridad Mexicana*/person_mentioned*.—6o Me dará cuenta oportunamte de los certificados que haya espedido, especificando el nombre de la cabeza de la *person_mentioned*familia*/person_mentioned*, m mero de la misma, y clase, prosedencia y ocupación 7o. Mani festará estas instrucciones al *person_mentioned*Sor Comandante de la *location_mentioned*frontera*/location_mentioned* Col. Dn José de las Piedras */person_mentioned*y se pondrá de acuerdo con el mismo Sor en los casos necesarios, á fin de obrar con mas acierto en no dar certificados á *person_mentioned*gente */person_mentioned*mala, y en remover embarazos á la venida á esta *location_mentioned*colonia */location_mentioned*de *person_mentioned*gente buena y útil*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
